title: Una Healy models her own clothing collection in Dublin
text:
Her ex-husband Ben Foden has signed up for Celebrity X Factor.

Yet Una Healy celebrated her own success on Tuesday as she attended the launch of her Littlewoods Ireland collection in Dublin.

Ahead of the event, The Saturdays star, 37, modelled her own Autumn/Winter 19 capsule.

Celebrate: Una Healy celebrated her own success on Tuesday as she attended the launch of her Littlewoods Ireland collection in Dublin

Una looked incredible as she put on a very leggy display in a pair of tiny high-waisted gingham shorts.

She teamed the item of clothing with a black dotted sheer blouse with a plunging vest top underneath.

Adding height to her petite frame, she accessorised with a pair of black and gold barely-there heeled sandals.

Una styled her auburn locks into a glossy blow-dried hairdo and added a slick of glamorous make-up.

Work it: Ahead of the event, The Saturdays star, 37, modelled her own Autumn/Winter 19 capsule

Incredible: Una looked incredible as she put on a very leggy display in a pair of tiny high-waisted gingham shorts

Finishing touches: She teamed the item of clothing with a black dotted sheer blouse with a plunging vest top underneath

The singer knew how to work her best angles as she posed up a storm while modelling her Littlewoods Ireland collection with an autumnal backdrop.

Una also took to her Instagram stories to share several updates of the day, revealing they had a brunch event to celebrate the collection.

It comes after the star's ex-husband Ben Foden has begged for her forgiveness after making 'the biggest mistake' by cheating on her.

Speaking to The Sun on Saturday, the rugby player, 34, admitted that he hoped the singer, 37, would forgive him for his infidelity during their marriage.

Fun times: Una also took to her Instagram stories to share several updates of the day, revealing they had a brunch event to celebrate the collection

'Forgiveness': It comes after the star's ex-husband Ben Foden has begged for her forgiveness after making 'the biggest mistake' by cheating on her

He said candidly: 'I hope Una will forgive me. I made the biggest mistake and the most ­stupid mistake you can make in a relationship.

'We seemed like a perfect match but people never know what happens behind closed doors. I think it’s safe to say that Una and I were struggling for a number of years.'

Ben added that cheating on her was 'the final nail in the coffin' of their marriage.

MailOnline have contacted Una's representatives for comment.

Former flame: Speaking to The Sun on Saturday, the rugby player, 34, admitted that he hoped the singer, 37, would forgive him for his infidelity during their marriage (pictured in May 2018)

Una and Ben married in Ireland in 2012 after four years of dating. They welcomed daughter Aoife shortly before they got married, and son Tadhg in 2015.

In February, he admitted cheating on Una, telling The Guardian: 'At the moment anything that’s published about me is never very good and pretty rightly so because I was the one who committed adultery.

'At the same time, it wasn’t the only reason for our divorce to go through. It’s not ideal, but we’re very amicable, we’re getting through it, we’re not the first people in the world to get divorced. We’ve got two little kids we adore.'

Wedding bells: Ben hit the headlines in August when he tied the knot with Jackie Belanoff just two weeks after they first began dating (pictured)

Ben's tattered reputation suffered a further blow in 2018 after he used dating app Bumble to publicly announce his separation from the former The Saturdays star.

The couple confirmed their separation after six years of marriage in July 2018, following his alleged affair with PR girl Becky Milne.

Ben hit the headlines in August when he tied the knot with Jackie Belanoff just two weeks after they first began dating.

And the rugby star will continue to remain in the spotlight as he has just signed up for ITV's Celebrity X Factor.
